original_title: Sri Lanka gives expatriate workers more time to qualify for EV permit
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers has extended a deadline given to expatriate workers who remit foreign exchange to the country to qualify for an electric vehicle import permit, Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
Expatriate workers were to be given an EV permit based on money remitted from May 01, 2022 to December 31, 2022.
But the amounts were insufficient to import an electric vehicle.
To give them time to remit more money, the deadline has been extended to September 15, 2023. (Colombo/May16/2023)
